Lemon Meringue Pie

A classic dessert featuring a tangy lemon filling topped with a fluffy meringue.

Ingredients

  • 1 pie crust
  • 1 cup white sugar
  • 2 teaspoons lemon zest
  • 1/2 cup lemon juice
  • 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
  • 3 tablespoons cornstarch
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt
  • 1-1/2 cups water
  • 2 tablespoons butter
  • 4 egg yolks, beaten
  • 4 egg whites
  • 6 tablespoons white sugar

Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
  2. Bake pie crust until lightly browned, about 10 minutes.
  3. In a saucepan, combine 1 cup sugar, flour, cornstarch, and salt; gradually stir in water.
  4. Cook over medium-high heat, stirring frequently, until mixture comes to a boil.
  5. Stir in butter, lemon zest, and lemon juice.
  6. Temper egg yolks by slowly mixing in some of the hot sugar mixture, then return all to the pan.
  7. Bring to a boil and continue to cook while stirring constantly until thickened.
  8. Pour filling into baked pastry shell.
  9. In a clean bowl, beat egg whites until soft peaks form; gradually add 6 tablespoons sugar and continue beating until stiff peaks form.
  10. Spread meringue over pie, sealing the edges at the crust.
  11. Bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes, or until meringue is golden brown.
